climbs.name: Water Works
climbs.fa: Kenn Kenaga and John Cardmon, August 2006

content.description: Thrutch up the two-part wide crack, passing a pinched down section in the middle.
content.location: The left leaning wide crack in the middle of the face.

content.description: Easy moves up a lower-angled tongue of rock leads to a well-featured vertical face where classic plate climbing (5.8) past 4 bolts ends at a ledge below a short but steep headwall. One final bolt protects juggy moves to anchors over the lip - stay direct over the last bolt for the best moves instead of cutting right.
content.location:
Located between

Bionicle

(5.10b) and

Flight Squadron

(5.10a) and just right of a striking crack system.

content.description: Easy face gains the first bolt and some interesting moves using flakes and plates. Move past the 2nd bolt and a nice horizontal crack to a recessed area and finish with some quick pulls over a steep section to finish. Easy walk-off down slabs to the climber's left.
content.location: This is the leftmost route on the Lower Kid Power Tower.

content.description:
Climb lower angled rock to the first bolt and then make some awkward moves to the 2nd bolt where the wall steepens to vertical. Continue up past interesting and balancy moves on mostly good plates to the crux at the 3rd bolt where you must utilize a thin, fragile flake. One more bolt leads to a large ledge where the route then cuts sharply left for one last bolt on a featured headwall to shared anchors with

Sky Patrol

.

Using a full length runner on the 4th bolt and a long draw on the 5th bolt is recommended to keep rope drag in check.
content.location: This is the rightmost route on Lower Kid Power Tower.

content.description: Climb an easy ramp to vertical face just left of a prominent left-arching crack system for two bolts and then cross the crack to a prominent chickenhead and the 3rd bolt (use a long draw on this bolt and then flip the rope over the chickenhead). Stand up on a narrow ledge, clip the last bolt and make the engaging and height dependant crux moves as you reach from a lefthand undercling to a distant but good edge at the lip - afterwards a quick mantle gains the anchors.
content.location:
Located between

Sky Cruiser

and

Sky Patrol

climbs.name: The Big Test
climbs.fa: Ryan Crochiere and John Cardmon, August 2006

content.description:
A challenging top-rope that climbs past multiple small roofs before joining

Flight Squadron

at a ledge two-thirds of the way.
content.protection:
Top-rope from anchors on

Flight Squadron
content.location:
Far right side of the face and 15 feet right of

Flight Squadron

.
